trans-unit.source: How to Use the Engagement API on Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Engagement API on Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: How to Use the Engagement API on Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Engagement API on Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: How to Use the Engagement API on Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: How to Use the Engagement API on Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: This document is an add-on to the document [How to integrate Mobile Engagement in your Windows Phone Silverlight app](../mobile-engagement-windows-phone-integrate-engagement/).
trans-unit.target: This document is an add-on to the document [How to integrate Mobile Engagement in your Windows Phone Silverlight app](../mobile-engagement-windows-phone-integrate-engagement/).

trans-unit.source: It provides in depth details about how to use the Engagement API to report your application statistics.
trans-unit.target: It provides in depth details about how to use the Engagement API to report your application statistics.

trans-unit.source: If you only want Engagement to report your application's sessions, activities, crashes and technical information, then the simplest way is to make all your `PhoneApplicationPage` sub-classes inherit from the `EngagementPage` class.
trans-unit.target: If you only want Engagement to report your application's sessions, activities, crashes and technical information, then the simplest way is to make all your `PhoneApplicationPage` sub-classes inherit from the `EngagementPage` class.

trans-unit.source: If you want to do more, for example if you need to report application specific events, errors and jobs, or if you have to report your application's activities in a different way than the one implemented in the `EngagementPage` classes, then you need to use the Engagement API.
trans-unit.target: If you want to do more, for example if you need to report application specific events, errors and jobs, or if you have to report your application's activities in a different way than the one implemented in the `EngagementPage` classes, then you need to use the Engagement API.

trans-unit.source: The Engagement API is provided by the `EngagementAgent` class.
trans-unit.target: The Engagement API is provided by the `EngagementAgent` class.

trans-unit.source: You can access to those methods through `EngagementAgent.Instance`.
trans-unit.target: You can access to those methods through `EngagementAgent.Instance`.

trans-unit.source: Even if the agent module has not been initialized, each call to the API is deferred, and will be executed again when the agent is available.
trans-unit.target: Even if the agent module has not been initialized, each call to the API is deferred, and will be executed again when the agent is available.

trans-unit.source: The following parts refine the Mobile Engagement Concepts for the Windows Phone platform.
trans-unit.target: The following parts refine the Mobile Engagement Concepts for the Windows Phone platform.

trans-unit.source: An *activity* is usually associated with one page of the application, that is to say the *activity* starts when the page is displayed and stops when the page is closed: this is the case when the Engagement SDK is integrated by using the `EngagementPage` class.
trans-unit.target: An *activity* is usually associated with one page of the application, that is to say the *activity* starts when the page is displayed and stops when the page is closed: this is the case when the Engagement SDK is integrated by using the `EngagementPage` class.

trans-unit.source: But *activities* can also be controlled manually by using the Engagement API.
trans-unit.target: But *activities* can also be controlled manually by using the Engagement API.

trans-unit.source: This allows to split a given page in several sub parts to get more details about the usage of this page (for example to known how often and how long dialogs are used inside this page).
trans-unit.target: This allows to split a given page in several sub parts to get more details about the usage of this page (for example to known how often and how long dialogs are used inside this page).

trans-unit.source: You need to call `StartActivity()` each time the user activity changes.
trans-unit.target: You need to call `StartActivity()` each time the user activity changes.

trans-unit.source: The first call to this function starts a new user session.
trans-unit.target: The first call to this function starts a new user session.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The SDK automatically call the EndActivity method when the application is closed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The SDK automatically call the EndActivity method when the application is closed.

trans-unit.source: Thus, it is HIGHLY recommended to call the StartActivity method whenever the activity of the user change, and to NEVER call the EndActivity method, since calling this method forces the current session to be ended.
trans-unit.target: Thus, it is HIGHLY recommended to call the StartActivity method whenever the activity of the user change, and to NEVER call the EndActivity method, since calling this method forces the current session to be ended.

trans-unit.source: You need to call `EndActivity()` at least once when the user finishes his last activity.
trans-unit.target: You need to call `EndActivity()` at least once when the user finishes his last activity.

trans-unit.source: This informs the Engagement SDK that the user is currently idle, and that the user session need to be closed once the session timeout will expire (if you call `StartActivity()` before the session timeout expires, the session is simply continued).
trans-unit.target: This informs the Engagement SDK that the user is currently idle, and that the user session need to be closed once the session timeout will expire (if you call `StartActivity()` before the session timeout expires, the session is simply continued).

trans-unit.source: You can use the job to track certains tasks over a period of time.
trans-unit.target: You can use the job to track certains tasks over a period of time.

trans-unit.source: As soon as a task tracked by a job has been terminated, you should call the EndJob method for this job, by supplying the job name.
trans-unit.target: As soon as a task tracked by a job has been terminated, you should call the EndJob method for this job, by supplying the job name.

trans-unit.source: There is three types of events :
trans-unit.target: There is three types of events :

trans-unit.source: Standalone events can occur outside of the context of a session.
trans-unit.target: Standalone events can occur outside of the context of a session.

trans-unit.source: Session events are usually used to report the actions performed by a user during his session.
trans-unit.target: Session events are usually used to report the actions performed by a user during his session.

trans-unit.source: Job events are usually used to report the actions performed by a user during a Job.
trans-unit.target: Job events are usually used to report the actions performed by a user during a Job.

trans-unit.source: There is three types of errors :
trans-unit.target: There is three types of errors :

trans-unit.source: Contrary to session errors, standalone errors can occur outside of the context of a session.
trans-unit.target: Contrary to session errors, standalone errors can occur outside of the context of a session.

trans-unit.source: Session errors are usually used to report the errors impacting the user during his session.
trans-unit.target: Session errors are usually used to report the errors impacting the user during his session.

trans-unit.source: Errors can be related to a running job instead of being related to the current user session.
trans-unit.target: Errors can be related to a running job instead of being related to the current user session.

trans-unit.source: The agent provides two methods to deal with crashes.
trans-unit.target: The agent provides two methods to deal with crashes.

trans-unit.source: You can send an exception at any time by calling :
trans-unit.target: You can send an exception at any time by calling :

trans-unit.source: You can also use an optional parameter to terminate the engagement session at the same time than sending the crash.
trans-unit.target: You can also use an optional parameter to terminate the engagement session at the same time than sending the crash.

trans-unit.source: If you do that, the session and jobs will be closed just after sending the crash.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, the session and jobs will be closed just after sending the crash.

trans-unit.source: Engagement also provides a method to send unhandled exceptions.
trans-unit.target: Engagement also provides a method to send unhandled exceptions.

trans-unit.source: This is especially useful when used inside the silverlight UnhandledException event handler.
trans-unit.target: This is especially useful when used inside the silverlight UnhandledException event handler.

trans-unit.source: This method will **ALWAYS** terminate the engagement session and jobs after being called.
trans-unit.target: This method will **ALWAYS** terminate the engagement session and jobs after being called.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to implement your own UnhandledException handler (especially if you have disabled the automatic crash reporting feature of Engagement).
trans-unit.target: You can use it to implement your own UnhandledException handler (especially if you have disabled the automatic crash reporting feature of Engagement).

trans-unit.source: For example, in the `Application_UnhandledException` method of the `App.xaml.cs` file :
trans-unit.target: For example, in the `Application_UnhandledException` method of the `App.xaml.cs` file :

trans-unit.source: When the user navigates forward, away from an application, after the Deactivated event is raised, the operating system will attempt to put the application into a dormant state.
trans-unit.target: When the user navigates forward, away from an application, after the Deactivated event is raised, the operating system will attempt to put the application into a dormant state.

trans-unit.source: In this process an application is terminated but some data about the state of the application and the individual pages within the application is preserved.
trans-unit.target: In this process an application is terminated but some data about the state of the application and the individual pages within the application is preserved.

trans-unit.source: You have to insert `EngagementAgent.Instance.OnActivated(e)` in the `Application_Activated` method from the App.xaml.cs file to reset the Engagement Agent when the application has been Tombstoned.
trans-unit.target: You have to insert `EngagementAgent.Instance.OnActivated(e)` in the `Application_Activated` method from the App.xaml.cs file to reset the Engagement Agent when the application has been Tombstoned.

trans-unit.source: You can get the engagement device id by calling this method.
trans-unit.target: You can get the engagement device id by calling this method.

trans-unit.source: Arbitrary data can be attached to an event, an error, an activity or a job.
trans-unit.target: Arbitrary data can be attached to an event, an error, an activity or a job.

trans-unit.source: These data can be structured using a dictionary.
trans-unit.target: These data can be structured using a dictionary.

trans-unit.source: Keys and values can be of any type.
trans-unit.target: Keys and values can be of any type.

trans-unit.source: Extras data are serialized so if you want to insert your own type in extras you have to add a data contract for this type.
trans-unit.target: Extras data are serialized so if you want to insert your own type in extras you have to add a data contract for this type.

trans-unit.source: Then, we will add a `Person` instance to an extra.
trans-unit.target: Then, we will add a `Person` instance to an extra.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] If you put other types of objects, make sure their ToString() method is implemented to return a human readable string.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] If you put other types of objects, make sure their ToString() method is implemented to return a human readable string.

trans-unit.source: Each key in the object must match the following regular expression:
trans-unit.target: Each key in the object must match the following regular expression:

trans-unit.source: It means that keys must start with at least one letter, followed by letters, digits or underscores (\_).
trans-unit.target: It means that keys must start with at least one letter, followed by letters, digits or underscores (\_).

trans-unit.source: Extras are limited to **1024** characters per call.
trans-unit.target: Extras are limited to **1024** characters per call.

trans-unit.source: You can manually report tracking information (or any other application specific information) using the SendAppInfo() function.
trans-unit.target: You can manually report tracking information (or any other application specific information) using the SendAppInfo() function.

trans-unit.source: Note that these information can be sent incrementally: only the latest value for a given key will be kept for a given device.
trans-unit.target: Note that these information can be sent incrementally: only the latest value for a given key will be kept for a given device.

trans-unit.source: Like event extras, use a Dictionary\<object, object\> to attach informations.
trans-unit.target: Like event extras, use a Dictionary\<object, object\> to attach informations.

trans-unit.source: Each key in the object must match the following regular expression:
trans-unit.target: Each key in the object must match the following regular expression:

trans-unit.source: It means that keys must start with at least one letter, followed by letters, digits or underscores (\_).
trans-unit.target: It means that keys must start with at least one letter, followed by letters, digits or underscores (\_).

trans-unit.source: Application information are limited to **1024** characters per call.
trans-unit.target: Application information are limited to **1024** characters per call.

trans-unit.target: In the previous example, the JSON sent to the server is 44 characters long:
